Deployed(address,bytes32,address).details: Emitted when a contract is deployed via `deploy()`.

params.deployedAddress: The address of the deployed contract.

deploy(bytes,bytes32).details: Deploy a new contract. Any attached ETH will be forwarded.

isDelegateCallSafe(address).details: Checks whether a given address is safe to be called via      delegatecall. A contract is considered unsafe if it includes any      of the following opcodes: CALLCODE, DELEGATECALL, SELFDESTRUCT,      CREATE, CREATE2, SLOAD, and STORE. This code is adapted from      https://github.com/dharma-eng/dharma-smart-wallet/blob/master/contracts/helpers/IndestructibleRegistry.sol

returns._0: True if the contract is considered safe for delegatecall.
